intro: Cosmea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered cosmea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branching. Cosmea parviflora is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
